column4: Man.... I hate to loose all the programs and customization I did... I mean I use this for everything
Good to know Darlok.... So I do I get back to my original setup (I don't see any frames on my applications
psych... That happen to me once, I had to reinstall gnome but I was missing some packages from gnome-session
I reinstalled all gnome packages.... that won't solve the kde problem though...
oh.... I thought I read something about kde....
yeah... that's what happened to me and I solved it with apt-get reinstalling ALL gnome packages
make sure you reinstall gnome-session
good luck psych
I spent hours last time when I realized I was still missing individual packages (like gnome-session)
shen2peru.... look on the printer setup menu or run NMAP
what is dnmap?  the printer setup doesn't allow me.
ok, installing it now
will that give me the hostname of the device too??  When I set it up in Windows (long time ago) it uses a hostname, and not an IP address, but it was a long string of stuff I don't remember
I thought you just wanted the IP address for other purposes (I assumed you were hacking - sorry)
ha ha, I'm looking at this trying to figure out what it is supposed to do. lol
will it give me the ip of my printer?
I enjoy learning hacking too, lol, what do I put under target?
cool, that is pretty neat trick!  Thanks.
yeah, I always have to put the ip address in that is why I'm thinking, I'm missing something here
if you just type the first few letters and hit tab, it will finish the persons name you are typing too.
.... cool!
yeah, I don't type your whole name out. lol
I wasn't able to do it through System -> Administration -> Printer ...  ..  I selected HPJet/Direct, and it needs the ip address, however this nmapfe is really cool. :)
